summary: This bill, the Open America's Waters Act, aims to repeal restrictions on coastwise trade, allowing foreign-built vessels to participate in domestic shipping. It amends Title 46 of the United States Code, specifically Section 12112(a), outlining conditions for vessels engaging in coastwise trade. The bill also includes conforming amendments to address safety regulations and related sections concerning tank vessels, liquified gas tankers, small passenger vessels, and other relevant maritime regulations.
